title: US midterms: Senate control handed back to Republicans âÂ live | US news | The Guardian
summary: love is first black republican woman elected to congress .
gop poised to claim historic house majority .
boehner : 'this is not a time for celebration '
ernst : 'we are going to make them squeal ! '
republican ernst projected to win iowa senate .
republicans take north carolina , win control of senate .
republican snyder projected to win michigan governor 's race .

text: we 're going to wrap up our live blog coverage for the time being .
here 's a summary of where things stand : it was a huge night for republicans and a horrible night for democrats .
the republicans won the senate and expanded their majority in the house to historic proportions .
the final tallies were unclear , with the virginia and alaska senate races still out and the final house count likewise in limbo .
but republicans were expected to up around 10 seats in the senate and 16 in the house .
the night started well for republicans with a win by incoming majority leader mitch mcconnell and after that they never looked back .
republican senate candidates won outright in georgia , in north carolina , in arkansas , in colorado , in kansas , and in iowa .
louisiana went to a runoff .

as impressively as they won the senate , the republicans performed even better in the governor 's races , swiping maryland , taking maine , winning the florida-michigan-wisconsin trifecta winning pretty much everywhere but colorado , where it looked like incumbent john hickenlooper might hold on .
there was scant good news for democrats .
jeanne shaheen held on in new hampshire .
minimum wage laws with democratic sponsorship passed in arkansas , illinois and south dakota , states that otherwise were seeing red .
oregon and washington dc passed marijuana legalization measures , while florida voted down medical marijuana .
the maine ballot initiative that would place restrictions on bear hunting is unresolved .

the maine gubernatorial result is official : dramatically unpopular republican governor paul lepage has won reelection : the associated press ( @ ap ) breaking : gop paul lepage wins re-election as governor of maine .
@ twitterid race call at 1:44 a.m. est .
# election2014 # apracecall
california voters have approved proposition 47 , which will change state sentencing laws , the sacramento bee reports : the measure was winning 58 percent to 42 percent .

the overwhelming support for this reform sends a powerful message nationally , demonstrating that voters are not just ready but eager to reduce prison populations in ways that can enhance public safety , said ethan nadelmann , executive director of the drug policy alliance .

a coalition of civil libertarian philanthropists , democrats and organized labor pushed the measure to alter punishments for nonviolent crimes a move they said would ultimately reduce crime and the statewide prison population .
read more here .
( h/t displaced/irreplaceable californian @ twitterid . )
those in the know think democratic governor john hickenlooper has a chance of hanging on in colorado .
here 's harry enten of fivethirtyeight : one place where democrats may salvage a victory is in colorado .
in the governor 's race there , republican bob beauprez leads the democratic incumbent , john hickenlooper , by 0.8 percentage points with 82 percent of precincts reporting .
the good news for hickenlooper , as the the upshot 's adjusted vote count shows , is that the remaining areas to report votes should shift the overall margin by 2.4 percentage points in his favor .
if that holds , hickenlooper will squeak by .

documents.title: love is first black republican woman elected to congress
text: the associated press has projected utah 's 4th district for mia love , who becomes the first african-american republican woman elected to congress .
too close to call in virginia , says abc news : jeff zeleny ( @ jeffzeleny ) abc news will not project a winner in # vasen race tonight .
vote count is too close .
warner currently has narrow edge .
there 's one house race that is not going well for an incumbent republican .
it 's in omaha , nebraska , and environs , where , with 68.8 % of the votes in , democratic challenger brad ashford is beating lee terry by a full three points , 48.8-45.8 .
jamie dupree ( @ jamiedupree ) rep lee terry r-ne is the only gop lawmaker currently trailing in a house race
good morning new york !
joel siegel ( @ joelmsiegel ) wednesday 's front page , ny daily news :
further bright spots more like dots , but still bright for the democrats : taniel ( @ taniel ) dems kept both kentucky house & iowa senate .
losses would have given the gop full control of state government , ushering in drastic reforms .
the only senate race not called apart from alaska , where it 's barely dark ?
virginia , where it 's already solidly wednesday .
according to the ap , with 99.9 % of the votes in , democrat mark warner is leading republican ed gillespie 49.1-48.5 .
cbs news politics ( @ cbspolitics ) with over 95 % of the vote in , we 're still seeing a toss-up in the va senate race between warner and gillespie
the democrat wins the senate race in hawaii .
what time is it in hawaii ?
just past 8pm , it looks like five hours behind et .
the associated press ( @ ap ) breaking : dem david ige wins election as governor of hawaii .
@ twitterid race call at 1:13 a.m. est .
# election2014 # apracecall
and there 's the call for baker , the republican , in massachusetts .
the final spread looks to be about 1.5 .
it 's not all that uncommon for massachusetts to elect a republican governor , by the way .
there were four , including one willard mitt romney , between michael dukakis and the outgoing deval patrick .
the associated press ( @ ap ) breaking : gop charlie baker wins election as governor of massachusetts .
@ twitterid race call at 12:53 a.m. est .
# election2014 # apracecall
@ gov is a good place to root around for insight as to how tonight 's election played out on social media : twitter government ( @ gov ) # ivoted lights up america .
animated map :

here 's a taste of some of the partisan sniping going on out there tonight in this case targeting the candidate many democrats hope will lead them to hold the white house in 2016 : jon ward ( @ jonward11 ) oh wow
slate notices that the number of women in congress will turn over into the triple digits come january : josh levin ( @ josh levin ) there are 100 women in congress for the first time ever

richard luscombe has written up a postmortem of the florida governor 's result , in which republican rick scott won reelection : scott ploughed about $ 68m ( â£ 42m ) into his effort to hold on to his job , according to the tampa bay times , in contrast to crist 's $ 36m .

ultimately , the sunshine state 's electorate figured they were better off sticking with scott , a controversial businessman who has struggled to remain popular since his surprise 2010 election win , than they were turning back to crist , who governed as a republican from 2007 to 2011 before switching his party allegiance .

the margin of scott 's victory slightly more than one percentage point and fewer than 80,000 votes ( with more than 99 % ) in a contest most analysts had agreed before election day was too close to call was confirmed only after last-minute legal wrangling .
read the full piece here .
democratic senator mark udall 's loss in colorado does n't have to be all bad , trevor timm writes in comment is free .

he should leak the cia torture report : the lame-duck transparency advocate now has a rare opportunity to truly show his principles in the final two months of his senate career and finally expose , in great detail , the secret government wrongdoing he 's been criticizing for years .

on his way out the door , udall can use congressional immunity provided to him by the constitution 's speech and debate clause to read the senate 's still-classified 6,000-page cia torture report into the congressional record on the floor , on tv , for the world to see .
read the full piece here .

the guardian 's rory carroll ( @ rorycarroll72 ) reports from iowa on ernst 's romp : ernst won an unexpectedly wide margin 8 points , with 87 % of districts reporting - after running a disciplined , well-funded campaign .
she attracted independent voters despite democratic attempts to de her as a sarah palin-style radical conservative .
we did it !
she exulted to cheering supporters just two hours after polls closed .
we are heading to washington and we are going to make em squeal !
the 44-year-old grandmother vowed to bring conservative midwest values to the capital .
tonight we 're taking the iowa way all the way to washington .
ernst , a national guard lieutenant colonel who served in iraq , promised to control spending , cut red tape and project us power .
this is the greatest nation in the history of mankind .
it looks like that des moines register poll putting ernst up 7 was a lot smarter than most everybody thought .

a bright spot for democrats : laws to raise the minimum wage passed in states where nothing else went right for the blue team : glenn thrush ( @ glennthrush ) if dems want a bright spot , it 's the slam dunk wins for minimum wage in wipeout states - ark , illinois , sd
seriously , this is how hard republicans won tonight : jennifer epstein ( @ jeneps ) karl rove .

arguably more resonant that we are going to make them squeal : paul lewis ( @ paullewis ) platitude of night , cory gardner : '' we won this election because we asked coloradans to lift their eyes to that great rocky mountain horizon . ''
massachusetts has voted in favor of a ballot initiative granting paid sick leave .
ben casselman of fivethirtyeight explains the measure : massachusetts currently does n't require employers to offer sick time of any kind , paid or otherwise .
but under the initiative approved tuesday , businesses with at least 11 employees will have to offer workers up to 40 hours of paid sick time each year .
( the exact amount is based on the number of hours an employee works . )

there 's a lot of chatter surrounding the maine gubernatorial returns , where incumbent paul lepage , who was supposed to be on life support and unable to see above 40 % , is trotting closer to 48 % percent over democrat mike michaud , with 55 % of precincts reporting .
in massachusetts , meanwhile , in an election to replace governor deval patrick , charlie baker is leading martha coakley 48.2-46.9 , with 95.5 % of precincts reporting .
finally , in maryland , republican larry hogan defeated anthony brown by what looks to be about five points .
doug mataconis ( @ dmataconis ) maryland governor goes gop .
anyone who says they predicted that one is probably lying fivethirtyeight 's harry enten sees a big wave .

while most people are paying attention to the senate races tonight , republicans also had an amazing night in gubernatorial elections , he writes : the gop won all the close races in which its candidates were favored , such as michigan and wisconsin .
republicans won the vast majority of close races in which they were slight underdogs , such as florida , illinois and maine .
they won in kansas , where we gave the gop incumbent , sam brownback , only a 20 percent chance .
and republicans have even taken maryland , where they had only a 6 percent chance of winning according to our last pre-election forecast .
the republican candidates are also leading in colorado and connecticut three races where polls favored the democratic candidates .
to put it mildly , this is a wave .
oliver griswold ( @ originalgriz ) maine .
massachusetts .
maryland .
that 's your wave .
the ap projects that governor butch otter will win reelection in idaho .
he defeated democrat aj balukoff .
the associated press ( @ ap ) breaking : gop c.l .
`` butch '' otter wins re-election as governor of idaho .
@ twitterid race call at 12:25 a.m. est .
# election2014 # apracecall

documents.title: gop poised to claim historic house majority
text: here 's a cherry on top or did the republicans already win that ?

here 's the sparkler stuck in the cherry : the republican majority in the house looks to climb to historic proportions , an advantage of 65-70 seats , not seen since the calvin coolidge years : rick klein ( @ rickklein ) gop 's house will be between 14-18 seats , per abc estimate sean t at rcp ( @ seantrende ) if abc 's projection is correct , gop gets largest house majority since 1928 .
hard not to call this a wave .

another race that was supposed to be in play for the democrats , another republican victory , this time in kansas : the associated press ( @ ap ) breaking : democrat paul davis concedes kansas governor 's race to republican incumbent sam brownback .

that reminds us , we still have n't seen a result for colorado governor , where the democratic incumbent is hoping to achieve the opposite result that losing incumbent senator and fellow democrat mark udall got tonight .
with 81.7 % of the vote in , according to ap , incumbent john hickenlooper is trailing republican bob beauprez by 0.9 % .
there 's nothing new york city likes more than a huge republican victory .
if only there were some way to write it on the sky .
thanks , cnn : jon williams ( @ williamsjon ) empire state building flashes red to mark republican success in seizing control of senate .
# election2014 # nyc ( h/t @ twitterid )
results in governor 's races are still trickling in .
the ap reports : dem john kitzhaber wins election as governor of oregon gop larry hogan wins election as governor of maryland
it 's an anticlimactic night in vermont , where the governor 's race pitting democrat pete shumlin , republican scott milne and a raft of others has ended with no candidate topping 50 % .
the legislature , which is controlled by the democrats , will now a winner .
the associated press ( @ ap ) breaking : vermont legislature will governor after no candidate wins majority .

the vote on the maine bear hunting ban initiative , which would outlaw using barrels full of donuts to attract bears to shoot and other arguably unsportsmanlike conduct , is still too close to call , for readers who were wondering .
( thx @ twitterid )

documents.title: boehner : 'this is not a time for celebration '
text: here 's what house speaker john boehner has to say about tonight 's result .
this is not a time for celebration , he says : zeke miller ( @ zekejmiller ) speaker boehner on outlook for the 114th congress ( h/t : @ twitterid )
as our live blog coverage continues , here 's a summary of where things stand : the republicans won the senate .
they are on track to up nine seats at least , with a notable surprise win in north carolina , and the virginia results still out .
the republicans won the key gubernatorial races in wisconsin , michigan and florida .
they knocked off pat quinn in illinois , too .
the republicans were on track to take control of the house of representatives , but it 's not yet clear by how many seats .
with senate wins in iowa , colorado and north carolina , republicans have a strong claim to have achieved an election wave at least by the judgment of , say , charlie cook of the cook report .
oregon and washington , dc , voted to legalize certain amounts of marijuana , while a medical marijuana ballot initiative was voted down in florida .
if you 're at this party , please shoot more of these .
it looks like it 's only going to get more fun in there .
the scene at nrsc party when joni ernst 's win secures the senate for the gop .
( h/t @ twitterid )
a further couple of results from the southwest , via ap : dem tom udall wins re-election to the u.s. senate in new mexico .
gop brian sandoval wins re-election as governor of nevada

documents.title: ernst : 'we are going to make them squeal ! '
text: ernst uses the occasion of her victory speech to make a castration joke .
it 's a long way from red oak to washington .
from the biscuit line at hardees to the us senate .
but thanks to all of you we are headed to washington .
and we are going to make em squeal !
the crowd loves it .
there is no way on earth you have n't seen this commercial yet if you 're still reading this blog but here it is , one more time .
squeal .
ernst is cackling during her speech .
not maniacally .
she just won a senate seat .
it 's a happy time .

documents.title: republican ernst projected to win iowa senate
text: the republicans , if they win alaska , have run the table .
democrat bruce braley falls in iowa .
the associated press ( @ ap ) breaking : gop joni ernst wins election to the u.s. senate in iowa .
@ twitterid race call at 11:37 p.m. est .
# election2014 # apracecall ernst is speaking , calling braley a worthy opponent .
we did n't agree on much , but i do admire anyone who is willing to stand up and fight for what they believe in .
well iowa , we did it !
oregon joins washington dc in legalizing marijuana , according to the local paper the oregonian .
with about half the vote counted , it 's 55 % -45 % , the guardian 's chris mcgreal reports .
supporters of republican michael grimm celebrate after he was re-elected in the midterm elections in staten island .
munoz/reuters republican supporters for governor scott walker react to results on election night , in milwaukee , wisconsin .
stathas/reuters
guardian data editor alberto nardelli notes that the party in control of the white house always loses seats in the midtems .
but it 's not usually a hemorrhage like this : in every midterm but three since 1862 , the party that controls the white house has lost seats .
to make matters even more difficult for the democrats , six of the 21 seats the party was defending today were in states president obama lost twice .
that said , over the past 21 years the party of the incumbent president has lost , in average , four senate seats during the midterms .

the republicans have gained six seats ( so far ) from the democrats , they have retained all the seats they were defending , and in most states outperformed the polls - against the forecasts , they kept kansas and took north carolina - a landslide .
ok , commenters .
what did n't the republicans win tonight ?

update : if you said the illinois governor 's race , where obama favorite pat quinn was running for reelection , you are w-r-o-n-g : the associated press ( @ ap ) breaking : gop bruce rauner wins election as governor of illinois .
@ twitterid race call at 11:26 p.m. est .
# election2014 # apracecall
they needed six .
they have six .
they held kansas and georgia and kentucky .
the republicans win : repbulcans win and here are all 100 seats , with only a few outstanding , and control to the gop under incoming senate majority leader mitch mcconnell : 100 seats

documents.title: republicans take north carolina , win control of senate
text: republican thom tillis has defeated democratic incumbent kay hagan in north carolina , ap projects .
the republicans won the night , big .
they swept the key senate races and the three big governor 's races .
they are still running hard in one state that forecasters were awarding the democrats , virginia .
the associated press ( @ ap ) breaking : republicans cinch control of us senate .
the voters have spoken .
and it is a cacophony .
ben casselman ( @ bencasselman ) so voters want a higher minimum wage , legal pot , abortion access and gop representation .
ok then .
have republicans just won the senate ?

fivethirtyeight is now giving it 99 % odds : republicans ' chances of winning the senate are now 99 percent , based on the abc news projection that republican david perdue has won in georgia without a runoff and republican pat roberts has won in kansas .
if you need more suspense than that in your election night , how about which state will put republicans over the top .
iowa ?
alaska ?
too easy ?
anybody willing to take virginia or north carolina ?
of course we are not reporting that the republicans have taken the senate , because they have not .
yet .
the democrats could technically still win all of those races .

documents.title: republican snyder projected to win michigan governor 's race
text: a republican trifecta in the three key governor 's races , florida , wisconsin and now michigan .
ap calls it a loss for democrat mark schauer and a win for the incumbent : the associated press ( @ ap ) breaking : gop rick snyder wins election as governor of michigan .
@ twitterid race call at 11:12 p.m. est .
# election2014 # apracecall
here 's our latest senate grid .
miserable for the democrats .
louisiana , the one in purple , is very likely to fall red in its december runoff .
but it does n't appear likely we 'll have to hold our breaths much longer to find out who controls the us senate for the 114th congress .
senate grid

documents.title: republican roberts projected to win kansas senate
text: another big blow for the republicans , with incumbent senator pat roberts holding his seat .
greg orman , an independent candidate , looked good in the polls for the duration .

the guardian 's kayla epstein brings us the big news from staten island , where the incumbent who faces 20 federal counts including perjury , fraud and employing undocumented immigrants at his restaurant healthalicious ( which name should be grounds for criminal charges ) has won reelection : kayla epstein ( @ kaylaepstein ) michael grimm just won re-election ( via @ twitterid ) back in april , i warned not to write him off

a few more incumbents go home happy : senate dem brian schatz wins re-election to the u.s. senate in hawaii gop jim risch wins re-election to the u.s. senate in idaho update : merkley holds in oregon , as expected .
if the democrats are desperate for a bright side , which they seem to be , they might say that this was one race that was expected to be competitive , so there .
the associated press ( @ ap ) breaking : dem jeff merkley wins election to the u.s. senate in oregon .
@ twitterid race call at 11 p.m. est poll close .
# election2014 # apracecall governor dem mark dayton wins re-election as governor of minnesota democrat jerry brown wins re-election as governor of california

as our live blog coverage continues , here 's a summary of where things stand : republicans struck an overwhelming series of blows in the last hour or so , winning senate races in colorado and georgia and governor 's races in florida and wisconsin .
it 's hard to point to four bigger races tonight .
democrats were clinging to control of the senate by a hangnail .
they were encountering more difficulty than expected in north carolina and even virginia , both races that were playing out with razor-thin margins and that could apparently still go either way .
we 're still waiting to hear from the michigan governor 's race and the iowa and kansas senate races , among others .
as expected , the louisiana senate race went to a runoff .
florida has voted down an initiative to legalize medical marijuana , but washington dc voted to legalize it in certain quantities outright , medical needs notwithstanding .
another republican win in another governor 's race : doug ducey , the state treasurer , has won the race in arizona , the ap projects .
ducey defeated democrat fred duval , a former aide to president bill clinton .

documents.title: republican walker projected to win wisconsin governor 's race
text: another big one for the republicans .
governor scott walker wins reelection in wisconsin , after surviving a recall vote in 2012 , after originally being elected in 2010 .
that means he 's been elected governor of wisconsin three times in the last four years .
walker is disliked by progressives , teacher 's unions and pro-labor groups for a so-called budget repair that took away the collective bargaining rights of state employees and cute medicaid rolls .
the opposition to walker is impassioned but he keeps winning .
rep. john barrow , the last white democrat from the deep south , has lost his seat in georgia , the networks are projecting .
james richardson ( @ jamesrichardson ) it took a decade , but republicans have finally toppled john barrow , the last remaining white congressional democrat from the deep south .

here 's how it played out , according to the new york times : less than two weeks before election day , the national republican congressional committee had spent nearly $ 1.93 million to oust mr. barrow , the democrat who is fighting for a sixth term , according to the center for responsive politics .

the democratic congressional campaign committee had spent about $ 1.96 million on the race , most of it dedicated to opposing rick allen , the republican challenger who owns a construction company based in augusta , ga .
here 's a snippet of mitch mcconnell 's victory speech .
the turtle is happy in his win :
a nice win in the new mexico governor 's race for the republican : the associated press ( @ ap ) breaking : gop susana martinez wins re-election as governor of new mexico .
@ twitterid race call at 10:27 p.m. est .
# election2014 # apracecall

documents.title: republican perdue projected to win georgia senate
text: that wheezing sound you hear is the democrats exhaling close to all that 's left of their hopes of hanging on to the senate .
there is still a very small path involving a flip in kansas and surprise victories elsewhere .
pourmecoffee ( @ pourmecoffee ) still a path for democrats , but it involves a wormhole and killing the right butterfly , so very risky .
but the democrats had hoped that candidate michelle nunn would at least take this race to a runoff , and in the final week she appeared close to doing so .
it turns out , not .
georgia republican u.s. senate candidate david perdue fixes his jacket as he arrives for his election night party , tuesday , nov. 4 , 2014 , in atlanta .
( ap photo/david goldman ) goldman/ap
here is maybe the story of the night : the margin in the virginia race is still razor thin , with 98.6 % of the vote counted .
mark warner , the incumbent democrat , leads challenger ed gillespie 48.7 % -48.6 % .
that 's a lot of red in our graphic tracking key senate races .
note that most polling indicates louisiana , the runoff there in purple , will fall republican when voters try again in december .

republicans could still fall short the six seats they 're looking for by losing in kansas and/georgia but that 's only if democrats sweep iowa and alaska and georgia , which would be tricky pool , especially considering they seem to be fighting for north carolina and even virginia .
key tossups

documents.title: republican scott projected to win florida governor 's race
text: the incumbent republican keeps his post .
democrat charlie crist was running slightly ahead in the polling averages down to the wire , and the democrats poured untold money and effort into the race .
a discouraging loss , right on the heels of the colorado senate defeat .
two other governor 's races to watch : wisconsin and michigan .
if republicans hold all three , they 'll have real cause to celebrate .
the associated press ( @ ap ) breaking : gop rick scott wins re-election as governor of florida .
@ twitterid race call at 10:20 p.m. est .
# election2014 # apracecall

documents.title: republican gardner projected to win colorado senate
text: ap : gop cory gardner wins election to the u.s. senate in colorado that 's a big win for the republicans , one that brings control of the senate within reach .
it 's another flip from the democrats the loser is incumbent senator mark udall and it 's in a state that obama won in 2012 .

cory gardner , center , republican candidate for the u.s. senate seat in colorado , joins supporters in waving placards on the corner of a major intersection in south denver suburb of centennial , colo. , early on tuesday , nov. 4 , 2014 .
zalubowski/ap
the democrat wins the rhode island governor 's race .
another projection come true .
the associated press ( @ ap ) breaking : dem gina raimondo wins election as governor of rhode island .
@ twitterid race call at 10:08 p.m. est .
# election2014 # apracecall
the guardian 's paul lewis ( @ paullewis ) has gone and hung out in a pot cafe outside of boulder , colorado , so you do n't have to .
unless you want to .
anyway , the patrons are n't voting this year : there was an outbreak of giggles in america 's first legal marijuana cafe when i asked the question .
so is anyone voting today ?
it was n't as if no one in the room was interested in politics .

for an hour they had been arguing over tax , policing , municipal regulation , the difference between democrats and republicans and what the founding fathers intended when they wrote the us constitution .
it was just that the patrons of club ned were high up in colorado 's rocky mountains 8,420 ft above sea-level and way above the clouds .
and they said they were not going to vote for anything that did n't involve marijuana .
read the full piece here .

documents.title: montana senate seat flips to republicans
text: max baucus ' departure to become ambassador to china left his democratic senate seat in montana vulnerable to being off .
now that 's happened .
that 's now four down for republicans , and two to go unless the party loses one of its current seats , which is entirely possible in georgia or kansas .

have a look : senate rundown here 's a roundup of results announced by the associated press around the 10 o'clock hour : senate gop steve daines wins election to the u.s. senate in montana governor gop matt mead wins re-election as governor of wyoming gop terry branstad wins re-election as governor of iowa

documents.title: louisiana senate race enters runoff
text: the decision desks did not wait long to call this one .

with 2.8 % of precincts reporting , according to ap , the senate race in louisiana is going to a runoff , with neither of the top two candidates , incumbent democrat mary landrieu or challenger republican bill cassidy , gaining 50 % of the vote .
the runoff was expected .
but that 's one fewer data point we 'll have in trying to figure out this evening who has won control of the senate .
we 'll have to wait until december .
the associated press ( @ ap ) breaking : louisiana senate race headed to runoff election in december .
every candidate plans an election night party but not all of them end up as festivals of joy .
visit our gallery of the best election night photos here .

10-year-old gabriella baiano holds a sign supporting mitch mcconnell in louisville , kentucky stapleton/reuters alice butler-short , a supporter of virginia republican senate candidate ed gillespie displays her american flag shoes at his election night party owen/ap democratic senate candidate alison lundergan concedes defeat in lexington , kentucky .
mcnamee/getty images

the voters of washington , dc , have voted in favor of marijuana legalization , npr reports : in the first of several widely watched votes on marijuana in the midterm election season , voters in washington , d.c. , have approved the legal use of marijuana for recreational purposes .
supporters of the d.c. marijuana measure had a 65-29.5 percent lead as of 9:09 p.m .
et , with 20,727 voting in favor .

more senate and gubernatorial results , again cooperating nicely with the projections : senate dem al franken wins election to the u.s. senate in minnesota gop mike enzi wins election to the u.s. senate in wyoming governor gop mary fallin wins re-election as governor of oklahoma
bush wins : george p. bush , son of prospective presidential candidate jeb and nephew of former president george w ( grandson of hw ) has won election as texas land commissioner .
how many president and future president do you see in this mona chalabi ( @ monachalabi ) 11 % george , 100 % bush
florida has voted down an initiative to legalize medical marijuana .
the proposal won 57 % support but it needed 60 % .
jeb lund attended a florida rally with state senator garrett richter and sampled the local opposition to the weed .

jeb writes in a comment is free piece , the republican faithful is comfortably dumb enough to worship at the bully pulpit : richter then asks if we 're ready to meet our next governor , then corrects himself , before reminding us what the n stands for .
it 's november , when we have to do some things : a ) reelect rick scott .
the crowd cheers .
b richter begins , before drawing a huge breath : down with marijuana !

as our live blog coverage continues , here 's a summary of where things stand : republicans are steaming along , up senate seats as predicted and putting pressure on democrats in unexpected places such as virginia and in some north carolina counties .
election night has recorded no upsets in statewide races thus far not a good sign for democrats , who need to upend some polling numbers if they hope to hold on to the senate .

there were bright spots for the democrats , as incumbent jeanne shaheen held onto her senate seat after a long fight in new hampshire and gary peters cruised to victory in the senate race in michigan .
republican mitch mcconnell got an early victory call in his bid to hold off democratic challenger alison lundergan grimes .
she earned a lot of votes and she earned my respect , he said .
republicans in general are having a romp of it , winning senate seats in arkansas , west virginia , south dakota , texas , nebraska and more .
the election protection coalition , which monitors irregularities at the polls , reported an increase of 40 % over the total number of hotline calls from election day in 2010 .
the republicans appeared to be on track to hold the house of representatives .

the virginia senate race continues to be highly exciting but the quants , who are looking at the political leanings of counties that have yet to report , still think the democrat wins it , as projected .
here 's fivethirtyeight : and in virginia , while it still looks more likely than not that mark warner will prevail , republican ed gillespie has done much better than polls projected .
a loss there would be every bit as devastating to democrats ' senate hopes as one in new hampshire would have been .
howard mortman ( @ howardmortman ) the latest ap on # vasen - 85 % in , gillespie ( 50 % ) v. warner ( 47 % )
the ap projects that republican pete ricketts has won election as governor of nebraska .
with 10.5 % of precincts reporting , ricketts held a 55-52 lead over democrat chuck hassebrook , with a libertarian candidate taking low-single-digits .
how alarming is tom brokaw 's ring tone ?
the nbc newsman was interrupted as he gave election results live on-air .
he recovers very nicely with a riff on groceries :

the scale of the voting troubles that cropped up across the country today has been underlined by new figures put out by the largest monitoring group the election protection coalition , the guardian 's ed pilkington ( @ edpilkington ) reports : it says that as of 8pm est some 18,498 had called its hotline to report difficulties they had casting their ballot - an increase of 40 % over the total in election day in 2010 .

the three hottest trouble spots where there were reports if long lines , voters turned away as they tried to vote and confusion were florida with 1,967 calls to the hotline , texas which has a new restrictive voter-id law in place with 1,876 calls and georgia with 1,815 .

documents.title: republicans on track to hold house
text: we 're keeping a peripheral view on the house races , where the republicans are expected to expand their majority .
one question : will they be able to up the eight seats they conceded to democrats in 2012 ?
if the republicans manage to up 11 seats , they will hit their drive to 245 ; if they up 13 , they 'll have an historic majority , not seen since 1928 .
so there are plenty of exciting benchmarks here .
all the ap is saying for now is that they are on track to hold it .
the associated press ( @ ap ) breaking : republicans on track to keep control of house if remaining incumbents win as expected .
the tea party favorite wins the senate race in nebraska to replace the retiring republican mike johanns .
the associated press ( @ ap ) breaking : ben sasse wins election to the u.s. senate in nebraska .
@ twitterid race call at 9:14 p.m. est .
# election2014 # apracecall

documents.title: democrat peters projected to win michigan senate
text: here are a swath of new results , around the nine o'clock hour .
again , no surprises , despite republican designs early on on that michigan senate seat gary peters just one .
senate gop john cornyn wins re-election to the u.s. senate in texas .
dem gary peters wins election to the u.s. senate in michigan dem dick durbin wins re-election to the u.s. senate in illinois governor dennis daugaard wins re-election as south dakota governor .
gop greg abbott wins election as governor of texas dem andrew cuomo wins re-election as governor of new york

the guardian 's jon swaine in new hampshire reports from the scene of a big celebration : jeanne shaheen 's supporters here in manchester just erupted in chants of her name after victory was declared by the networks for the first-term democrat over her republican challenger , scott brown , in the new hampshire senate race .
shaheen appears to have done better than was forecast in final opinion polls , which gave her a barely-there lead of up to one percentage point .
a look at the returns in some of the wealthier suburbs of manchester , which lean strongly republican , gives a glimpse of why .
senator jeanne shaheen hugs a volunteer holding a sign as she heads in to vote at the town hall in madbury , new hampshire .
senter/ap brown did not do well enough in places like these to outperform john sununu , the republican whom shaheen defeated by 51.6 % 45.2 % in 2008 .
in goffstown , for instance , brown actually did worse than sununu .
while brown beat shaheen today by 53.1 % to 46.9 % a margin of 6.2 percentage points , or 383 votes , sununu 's beat her in 2008 by 8.6 points , or 744 votes .
shaheen 's win may give democrats hope that tonight will not turn out as bad as some feared .
the south dakota senate seat was a predicted for the republicans , along with west virginia and though it has not been called yet montana .
here 's a graph with some tossup races , illustrating the republican need for six new seats to rise from their current tally of 45 to a majority of 51 .
here 's guardian data editor alberto nardelli : having taken west virginia , south dakota and arkansas from the democrats , the republicans need three more gains in order to win a senate majority .
this assuming gop retains all the seats the party is defending .
should the party lose any of its seats , such as kansas or georgia where the races are expected to be close , the republicans would then need to gain four seats .
should they lose both seats , they 'll need five gains , and so on .
key staets

documents.title: democrat shaheen projected to win new hampshire senate
text: the networks are calling new hampshire for incumbent democrat jeanne shaheen , who defeats republican scott brown .
that makes brown a loser in senate races in two states .
ezra klein ( @ ezraklein ) still my favorite moment of the night , so far :

documents.title: republican mike rounds projected to win south dakota senate
text: reublican mike rounds up the south dakota senate seat vacated by democrat tim johnson in his retirement .
what can we expect from tom cotton , the republican congressman who was just elected to the senate from arkansas ?
big things , it seems .

mother jones has reported on how , a number of years ago , cotton called for the imprisonment of national security journalists on espionage charges : in 2006 , tom cotton , a twentysomething us army lieutenant serving in iraq , wrote an open letter calling for the prosecution and imprisonment of two of the new york times ' most prominent reporters , eric lichtblau and james risen , who had just broken a major story about how the government was tracking terrorist financing .
the letter , which also called for the prosecution of bill keller , the times ' then-executive editor , was initially published on the conservative blog powerline but soon went viral .
the letter included this memorable line : by the time we return home , maybe you will be in your rightful place : not at the pulitzer announcements , but behind bars .

senator rand paul , who just may run for president in 2016 , spent yesterday campaigning with mitch mcconnell , who tonight has won the race that may catapult him into the senate majority leader seat .
paul the elder is n't such a fan of the new leadership mcconnell represents : ron paul ( @ ronpaul ) republican control of the senate = expanded neocon wars in syria and iraq .
boots on the ground are coming !
( h/t @ twitterid )
how is the republican attempt to take over the senate going ?
there are signs , from county returns in north carolina to early numbers in virginia , that republicans are having a strong night .
they have the early piece of a kentucky win in place .
but on the state level , the tossup races that will ultimately tell the story of this election have not yet been decided .
think georgia , kansas , iowa , colorado , and alaska and , if we 're talking upsets , north carolina , new hampshire or virginia .
two democrats in the northeast easily hold their senate seats , as anticipated , the ap projects : chris coons wins election to the u.s. senate in delaware .
jack reed wins election to the u.s. senate in rhode island here 's how our senate grid is shaping up : senate grid
the new hampshire governor 's race has been called for democrat maggie hassan , who had a late-race scare , if the polling is to be believed , from republican walt havenstein .
with 15.3 % of precincts reporting , according to the associated press , hassan enjoys a 56.8-43.2 lead .
the senate race in new hampshire , where incumbent jeanne shaheen is trying to fend off former massachusetts senator scott brown , is still too close to call .

here 's a terrifying dispatch from the guardian 's rory carroll ( @ rorycarroll72 ) from des moines , iowa , where most canvassers have called it a night , but eric thorson , 40 , is keeping a lonely vigil on the corner of 2nd ave and court st , with a white costume and painted face , distributing flyers urging people to vote republican .
sad republiclown .
carroll why ?
because the democrats discriminate against white people . '
thorson says he 's been out all day .
the streets are now cold and deserted , but he 's not quitting .
its an important message . '
we 're back to mcconnell 's speech - apologies for that interruption .
mcconnell is speaking of a compact that every generation has made .
as i 've traveled through kentucky i 've sensed new doubts .
they 're hungry for new leadership above all they want some reassurance that the people who run the government are actually on their side .
cheers for that line .
mcconnell tells kentuckyans : i 've heard your concerns .
i 've made them my own .
you will be heard in washington .
he says the campaign was about a government that people no longer trust to carry out its most basic duties because it 's too busy being focused on things it should n't be focused on at all .
senate minority leader mitch mcconnell is joined by his wife , elaine chao , to celebrate with supporters at an election night party in louisville , kentucky .
scott applewhite/ap

documents.title: republican tom cotton projected to win arkansas senate
text: cotton beats incumbent democrat mark pryor , according to projections by the networks .
asa hutchinson wins the arkansas governor 's race , meanwhile , which was much closer than the senate race .

documents.title: mcconnell : grimes 'deserves a lot of credit '
text: senator mcconnell , just reelected , is speaking .
boy , mcconnell is feeling great .
he 's cracking the jokes : i work hard to bring your concerns to washingotn and i will not let up .
every election is a job interview .
in this case a very long one .
[ exuberant laughs ] i 'd like to make an announcement : no more campaign commercials .
[ exuberant cheers ] then mcconnell strikes a gracious note , speaking highly of his opponent , alison lundergan grimes : she earned a lot of votes and she earned my respect .
it took a lot of guts she took some heat .
she deserves a lot of credit for it.this was certainly a hard-fought contest .
do you count yourself among those election watchers who is not afraid of preliminary exit polling results , warnings as to their consistent unreliability be damned ?
well then , dig in .
the whole kit and caboodle lives on the washington post web site .

the results have usual key democratic blocs not showing their usual strong numbers for the democrats , with women voters going only 53-45 for democrats , and young voters aged 18-29 going 55-42 for the dems .

one group that appears to have hewed to its predicted political preference as a demographic : black voters democrats by a 90-9 margin , according to these once again it must be emphasized provisional and preliminary exit polls .

documents.title: grimes : 'this fight was worth it '
text: alison lundergan grimes , the democrat who lost tonight to mitch mcconnell , is delivering her concession speech .
the crowd is cheering her as she names kentucky counties where her campaign team turned out voters .

this was made possible because of an amazing husband , an amazing family a dedicated staff , and each and every one of you , she says : while tonight did n't bring us the result we had hoped for , this journey , the fight for you , was worth it .
i will continue to fight for the commonwealth of kentucky each and every day .
a governor falls in pennsylvania : wpxi ( @ wpxi ) # breaking : nbc news projects that tom wolf will win the pa. governor 's race over incumbent tom corbett .
# wpxipolitics the republican governor 's association had long ago given up corbett 's seat for lost .
corbett did hang on longer than incumbent hawaii governor neil abercrombie , who lost his august primary .
eric boehm ( @ ericboehm87 ) corbett becomes the first incumbent governor to lose a re-election bid in pa history ( only allowed to seek a second term since 1970 ) .

documents.title: judge rejects crist suit to extend florida voting
text: in florida 's broward county , circuit court judge jack tuter has rejected charlie crist 's motion to extend polling by two hours until 9pm , richard luscombe reports for the guardian : crist , the democratic party challenger to incumbent republican governor rick scott , had claimed broken polling machines were denying citizens their right to vote .
those who were in line at 7pm , however , were still allowed to cast their ballot .
with 65 per cent of the votes counted statewide , only a third of one per cent separated the candidates in what is shaping up to be the nation 's tightest gubernatorial race .
as expected , republican senator lamar alexander holds his seat in tennessee , ap projects .
our senate grid , which has developed quite quickly , if along rather predictable lines , now looks like this : senate grid

documents.title: senate races : 6 new winners include booker in new jersey
text: the associated press has called a stack of races around the 8 o'clock hour ( et ) .
in addition to the sessions call , the ap has winning : senate jim inhofe wins re-election to the u.s. senate in oklahoma .
james lankford wins election to the u.s. senate in oklahoma cory booker wins re-election to the u.s. senate in new jersey ed markey wins re-election to the u.s. senate in massachusetts .
susan collins wins re-election to the u.s. senate in maine .
thad cochran wins election to the u.s. senate in mississippi .
governor bill haslam wins re-election as governor of tennessee robert bentley wins re-election as governor of alabama

cbs news sets a new benchmark for fearless forecasting : cbs news politics ( @ cbspolitics ) projection : republican incumbent jeff sessions wins the alabama senate race - sessions ran unopposed ( thx @ twitterid )
there 's some restlessness around the senate results so far in virginia , which most forecasters saw as a win for incumbent democrat mark warner .
republican ed gillespie appears to be running more strongly than anticipated .
here 's the new york times model digging into the early results : rebecca berg ( @ rebeccagberg ) whoa .
upshot model has va looking good for gillespie .

and here 's fivethirtyeight from about an hour ago : the democrat , mark warner , is slightly ahead in the exit polls , but not by as much as in pre-election surveys , which put him up by an average of 9 percentage points .
[ ] warner is still the favorite to pull out the race : exit polls are n't necessarily all that informative as compared with pre-election surveys .
we 'll be getting more real votes in soon .
but for what it 's worth , if republican ed gillespie wins , it would be one of the bigger polling errors in recent memory in a senate election a once-or-twice-a-decade type miss .

if gillespie does pull this out , maybe we can credit this ad , in which he says he will oppose attempts to require the locally based national football league team , the washington redskins , to change its name :

documents.title: florida governor 's race tight as first results come in
text: with 18.9 % of precincts reporting in florida , gubernatorial candidates charlie crist , the democrat , and rick scott , the republican incumbent , are running just four-tenths of a percentage point apart , according to an associated press tally .

as our live blog coverage continues , here 's a summary of where things stand : republicans were off to a strong start with senate wins in kentucky , south carolina ( x2 ) and west virginia , and gubernatorial wins in south carolina and ohio .
senator mitch mcconnell won reelection in kentucky and seemed poised to become senate majority leader , should republicans take the senate .
challenger alison lundergan grimes called him to concede .
lawyers and voter registration groups around the country reported an unusual level of irregularities and glitches at polling stations .
the campaign of florida democrat charlie crist sued to keep polling stations in florida 's broward county open until 9pm et two hours past the planned closing time to allow everyone to vote .

tim scott , who was just elected junior senator from south carolina ( on a team with lindsey graham , who just won a third term ) , has become the first african-american elected to the senate from the deep south since post-civil war reconstruction .
scott had been appointed to the seat following the departure from the senate of jim demint .
matthew cooper ( @ mattizcoop ) tim scott 's win was inevitable but still a landmark for the south and the country .
a secretary of state , she was the last candidate to run against mitch mcconnell before he moved into position to become senate majority leader .

who is who is i know this irin carmon ( @ irin ) people are watching jeopardy at the bar of the grimes party jeff zeleny ( @ jeffzeleny ) the call : @ twitterid just called mitch mcconnell to concede the election , @ twitterid has learned .
what do you know ?

legal wranglings over voting in florida 's broward county , reports richard luscombe for the guardian : broward 's infamous hanging chads and dimples on ballot papers created the election farce that kept the nation waiting for a month before the us supreme court stepped in and declared george w bush the winner of the 2000 presidential election .

charlie crist , the democratic candidate seeking to unseat incumbent republican rick scott from the florida governor 's mansion , has filed an emergency motion to keep polling booths in the county open for an additional two hours , until 9pm , citing failure of electronic counting equipment and excessively long lines of citizens still waiting to cast their ballots .
crist 's motion to the 17th judicial circuit claims those in line are being denied a meaningful opportunity to cast their votes .
crist , the state 's governor as a republican from 2007 to 2011 , needs every vote he can get in the democratic strongholds of south florida in a race widely seen as too close to call .
as expected already the phrase , applied to a republican win , feels like a broken record governor john kasich wins in ohio , the networks and ap project .
republicans go into tonight 's election with a 29-21 majority of the country 's governor 's mansions .
they could lose one or more in , say , florida , michigan or wisconsin .
holding all three would be one of many indicators of a very strong night for the gop .
the associated press ( @ ap ) breaking : john kasich wins re-election as governor of ohio .
@ twitterid race call at 7:30 p.m. est poll close .
# election2014 # apracecall
and now we have the first republican of a senate seat tonight , as shelley moore capito is projected to win in west virginia , defeating democrat natalie tennant .
capito will replace retiring democratic senator jay rockefeller .
again , it 's an entirely expected result .
the associated press ( @ ap ) breaking : shelley moore capito elected to u.s. senate in west virginia .
@ twitterid race call at 7:30 p.m. est poll close .
# election2014 # apracecall president barack obama lost west virginia by a whopping 28 points in 2012 .
it 's one of three states , with south dakota and montana , where republicans are expected to up senate seats from retiring democratic senators .
that might also happen in iowa .
the 2014 election enters the books as the most expensive midterms ever , with the the center for responsive politics estimating a total bill of $ 3.67bn .

the wall street journal has the bright idea of making a list of things americans spend more on annually , based on bureau of economic analysis estimates of annual household consumption : new cars : $ 95.8 bn casino gambling : $ 88.4bn hairdressers : $ 63.0bn beer : $ 59.9 bn the list goes on and on .
read it here .
( h/t @ twitterid )

the guardian 's megan carpentier ( @ megancarpentier ) reports from kentucky with one happy note on concerns about potential voter suppression in the state : in the wake of reports ( highlighted by the brennan center ) that an anonymous person or persons had placed an advertisement in the weekly berea city newspaper encouraging people to challenge berea college students ' ability to vote in today 's elections , the college 's student government president jacob burdette confirmed to the guardian that , to his knowledge , none of the students faced challenges .

we had between 250 and 300 students take our shuttles to the polls , and plenty of others drive or walk on their own , he said , and there was only one challenger in student-voting districts who completed his or her training , burdette said .
kentucky law only allows election officials and designated challengers who complete an official course to challenge anyone at the polls , a law which common cause called one of the best such laws .
filling in the senate grid has begun .
it 's all red so far .
but in the next hour polls will close in two states democrats hope and many say democrats need to take , north carolina and new hampshire .
the states may not be projected immediately either way .
senate grid
with the reelection of nikki haley as governor , it 's a republican sweep of the top statewide offices in south carolina .
usa today washington ( @ usatwashington ) per ap , nikki haley has been re-elected in the # scgov race
the kentucky result is a happy , if expected , start for republicans .
as late as a month from election day , some pollsters found grimes , the democrat , running even with the prospective senate majority leader .
mcconnell seemed to pull away in the final weeks , however , taking a better-than-7-point lead in the polling averages .
mitch mcconnell : winner .

scott applewhite/ap if the chips fall well for the republicans tonight , mcconnell , who has been in the senate for 30 years and has been minority leader since 2007 , will finally grab the majority leader 's spot .
democrats attempted to salvage the race with a late-october commitment of $ 650,000 in ad spending .
soon after , ap reported , senate majority pac announced it , too , would return to kentucky airwaves .
it already had spent $ 4.4 million in ads criticizing mcconnell , making kentucky second only to the $ 7.8 million the group had spent in north carolina .

documents.title: mcconnell projected to win in kentucky
text: at the minute of poll closings in kentucky , the networks are projecting that senator mitch mcconnell , the republican incumbent , has won reelection , defeating democratic challenger alison lundergan grimes .
the associated press projects republican wins , as expected , in the two south carolina races as well .
ap politics ( @ ap politics ) breaking : republicans win senate race in ky , both senate seats in sc .

former florida governor and democratic gubernatorial candidate charlie crist heads out of the mid-county senior center , during a four-city bus campaign tour in lake worth , florida audette/reuters a voter hands over her ballot at a barber shop used as a polling station in chicago , illinois .
young/reuters jordan williams , 10 , looks on as his mother , pamela williams , casts her ballot in ferguson , missouri .
curtis/reuters

as the united states went to the polls for the first time in 50 years without the full protection of the federal voting rights act on tuesday , lawyers and voter registration groups around the country reported an unusual level of irregularities and glitches at polling stations , the guardian 's ed pilkington ( @ edpilkington ) reports : the largest non-partisan voter protection coalition in the us received more than 12,000 calls to its hotline from people struggling to cast their ballot amid a slew of new voter-id laws .

the coalition of 150 groups led by the lawyers ' committee for civil rights under law said it has received an unusually high volume of distress calls from would-be voters to its eight call centers across the country .
read the full piece here .
the race to election day 2014 has ended with a 42 % approval rating for president barack obama , near his all-time low , according to gallup 's daily poll tracker .
disillusionment with the democratic president could hurt democrats generally , and may be especially damaging in two tossup states that obama managed to win in 2012 : colorado and iowa .
the republicans have fielded strong candidates for senate in both places .

while obama has popped up only intermittently on the campaign trail this election season , he has done a last-minute streak of radio for election day , guardian washington bureau chief dan roberts reports : dan roberts ( @ robertsdan ) looks like obama 's been ringing up a lot of local radio stations on the quiet .
14 interviews in the last 24 hours despite silence nationally
pace kanye , there is plenty of time in most states to make it to the polls before they close .
kanye west ( @ kanyewest ) i know it 's last minute , but if you have n't voted , please vote today here 's a map of polling station closing times across america .
some states , including connecticut and georgia , have ordered some stations to stay open later because of delays or complications in voting .
update : the charlie crist team is suing to add florida to the list of states with extended polling hours .
omar khan ( @ omardanielkhan ) the campaign is filing an emergency motion to extend voting hours in broward county from 7pm to 9pm .
see the motion : daily kos elections ( @ dkelections ) this is a must-bookmark link for election junkies : our poll closing times map

tuesday 's congressional elections are likely to have implications for the course of the war against isis militants in iraq and syria , reports guardian us national security editor spencer ackerman ( @ attackerman ) : should republicans gain control of the senate , arizona republican john mccain will probably become chairman of the influential armed services committee .
sen. john mccain .

scott applewhite/ap a vociferous critic of obama 's foreign policy generally and his campaign against isis in particular , mccain favors expanding the war 's aims to overthrowing assad as a gambit to convince syrians to back the us against isis in return .
obama has resisted that step , fearing subsequent us responsibility for a fractured syria reminiscent of the painful post-saddam occupation of iraq .
read the full piece here .

though most of the national attention bestowed on kentucky has focused on the mcconnell-grimes senate battle , union workers are almost just as interested in which way their statehouse will swing , reports the guardian 's megan carpentier ( @ megancarpentier ) : a democratic loss of only 5 seats will put the second half of the bicameral legislature in republican hands and , through a quirk of kentucky law , give that party a veto-proof majority over democratic governor steven bashear .
( it takes only a simply majority to override the governor 's veto . )

kentucky 's unions and union workers expect that one of the first items on the republican agenda will be the creation of a right to work state which union worker chawan morgan , an employee of the grocery store chain kroger in louisville , explained is definitely not what it sounds like .
instead , right to work laws prohibit unions from negotiating union security clauses , which require that all workers benefitting from collective bargaining pay dues to support the union .
its effect : defunding the unions .

so once you get rid of the unions , nothing stands in the way of the company doing what it wants to do , which is basically work you for less pay , work you for longer hours and just basically treat you like nothing , for real , morgan explained .
abigail shake and chawan morgan .

carpentier for morgan and fellow union member and kroger employee , abigail shake , the issues of right to work , raising the minimum wage and equal pay for women were important enough to spend their non-working time helping their union elect democratic candidates , including would-be senator alison lundergan grimes .

shake explained that her first campaign has already inspired her to go back to college so that she can better people , to better working families , because , like chawan was saying about right to work , it 'll put a lot of people out of a lot of money , and that 's single mothers who have to chose between paying the rent and putting food on the table and that 's not right .

and shake , who had her first experience with unequal pay for equal work while working her first job at taco bell at age 16 , also had a few words and one raised eyebrow for republicans who say that unequal pay is the result of women 's choices : that 's ignorant .
that 's very , very ignorant .
how to follow tonight 's results as they come in ?
the guardian 's interactive desk has created a few useful tools .
we 'll track results in the senate , house and governor 's races on an interactive map to be found here .
to focus on the senate , the grid below is a useful touchstone .
the blank squares represent the senate races playing out in 36 states : thirty-six states are running senate races tonight .

a conservative watchdog group is declining to disclose locations in new hampshire that it is monitoring for voting fraud , in case this stops people from trying to commit that fraud , the guardian 's jon swaine reports : lawyers and volunteers from washington-based judicial watch have been observing at polling stations to check that the granite state 's photo-id requirements for voters are being followed .
announcing the operation last month , the group said it was intended to deter election fraud .
breitbart , the conservative news website , claimed it would specifically stop sen. jeanne shaheen ( d-nh ) or her allies from committing fraud .
shaheen faces a republican challenger , scott brown .
u.s. sen. jeanne shaheen on monday .
cole/ap accusing the obama administration of making unhinged attacks on voter id , tom fitton , judicial watch 's president , warned that the left plans to sow confusion on election day .

yet robert popper , the attorney for the group who is leading its monitoring effort , told the guardian on tuesday that he preferred not to say exactly where they were operating because would-be vote fraudsters could read his remarks and be deterred from trying to breaking electoral law .
we want people who might be coming to vote in new hampshire for wrong reasons to wonder about whether we are going to be there and we ca n't cover everywhere , said popper .

jon swaine ( @ jonswaine ) conservative watchdog @ twitterid wo n't tell me nh spots it 's monitoring to deter voter fraud in case this deters attempted voter fraud it is perhaps presumptuous to expect that we have any deterrent effect whatsoever , but we want to catch the electoral situation in its native state , so to speak .
popper , a former senior official in the voting section of the us justice department 's civil rights division , said he and a team of less than 20 people had discovered causes for concern .

he estimated that 6-9 % of voters in stations where his team were observing had completed same-day voting registrations , and that 0.5-2 % of these did so by signing affidavits in lieu of the proof of id , citizenship and residence that is ty required .
popper claimed that based on past experience , efforts to check such sworn statements after elections are likely to be lacking .
welcome to our ongoing live blog coverage of the us midterm elections .
it wo n't be long now an hour !
until we have our first results of the night in some of the tossup races likely to determine control of the senate .

that 's tonight 's big prize , but there are plenty of other fascinating contests going , from a few seriously cutthroat governor 's races to proposals that could change how states enjoy their sex , drugs and guns .

republicans have high hopes going into this evening of taking control of the us senate , which would give them full control of congress and a significant new lever to use against president barack obama in his final two years of office .
in the senate , 36 seats are in play tonight , as are all 435 seats in the house of representatives and 36 governors ' mansions .
guardian correspondents are spread across the country tonight to bring readers what 's happening from state to state .
all of their dispatches will be featured in this blog , interwoven with results , analysis and local color .
there will be speeches .
there may be upsets .
there will probably be tears one tear , at least .
by the end of the evening , some 90 million people , a whopping 40 % of the electorate , will have voted , if history is a guide .
we 'll have a clearer of what obama may be able to accomplish , or not , in his final two years on pet issues such as climate change and immigration reform .
we 'll know more about the american electorate , too who we are and what kind of leadership we 're after .
we invite you to join us this election night .
we further invite you to read our live coverage thus far , if you have n't already , in this rollicking blog by alan yuhas ( @ alanyuhas ) .
and then maybe have a listen to how some 2014 midterms voters are describing how they cast their ballots today :
